00060 
00061 /**
00062  * \addtogroup FeatureTracking
00063  * \brief  Routines for assembling Regions Of Interest into Features.
00064  *
00065  * \description 
00066  *
00067  *   The feature tracking module provides routines for assembling Regions of
00068  *   interest from a series of different steps (usually time steps) into
00069  *   Features.
00070  *
00071  *   In each (time) step, tracking occurs in three steps.
00072  *   - 1. A score matrix is computed which indicates the amount of
00073  *        correspondence between each ROI in a new step with the ROI's
00074  *        in the previous step. 
00075  *   - 2. The score matrix is analyzed and a correspondence matrix is created
00076  *        which indicates, by a nonzero value, which of the new ROIs 
00077  *        correspond with the previous ROIs.
00078  *   - 3. The correspondence matrix and the ROIs are used to construct the 
00079  *        features.
00080  * 
00081  *   The routine \ref fc_trackAllSteps() takes in the ROIs over a number of
00082  *   steps and returns a Feature Group containing the features.
00083  *   The routine \ref fc_trackStep() allows the addition of
00084  *   a single step.
00085  *
00086  *   The default algorithm for computing the score score matrix
00087  *   (fc_computeNumOverlapScore) is based on the number of overlapping
00088  *   entities. The default algorithm for computing the correspondence matrix
00089  *   (fc_computeSimpleCorrespond) is just convert the score matrix to an
00090  *   int matrix.  The default algorithm for feature assignment
00091  *   (rc_addROIsUsingBasicEvents) is to start new features if there is a split
00092  *   or merge event (and of course when there is a new feature).
00093  *
00094  *   The routines \ref fc_trackAllSteps_custom() and 
00095  *   \ref fc_trackStep_custom()  allow the user to provide their own
00096  *   implementations of each of the three steps in the tracking process. A
00097  *   value of NULL indicates that the default implementation of that step be
00098  *   used.  The matrices are accessed by matrix[i][j] where i is the index into
00099  *   the previous step's ROI list and j is the index into the new step's ROI
00100  *   list.  Note that a modified Feature Group may be needed if you implement
00101  *   a different feature assignment step.
00102  *
00103  * \todo ? Should the score matrix and correspondence matrix really be separate
00104  *      routines?
00105  *
00106  * \modifications
00107  *   - FEB-18-2003  W Koegler  Created
00108  *   - APR-01-2003  W Koegler  Adapted to use feature groups
00109  *   - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Integrated into FCLib
00110  *   - 07/01/04 WSK Changed to take FC_Subsets instead of Linked Lists
00111  */
00112 
00113 /**
00114  *\ingroup FeatureTracking
00115  *\defgroup FeatureTrackingPrivateHelpers (Not available outside this module)
00116  */
00117 
00118 void _fc_freeIntMatrix(int numPrev, int numNew, int** matrix);
00119 void _fc_freeDoubleMatrix(int numPrev, int numNew, double** matrix);
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00123  * \brief      Track and create features for a new step.
00124  *
00125  * \description
00126  *  
00127  *    For a specific step, track and add the new ROIs to the feature group. 
00128  *
00129  * \modifications  
00130  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00131  */
00132 FC_ReturnCode fc_trackStep(
00133   int stepIndex,           /**< input - the index of the step */
00134   int numNew,              /**< input - the number of new segments */
00135   FC_Subset* newSegments,  /**< input - the new segments to be added */
00136   FC_FeatureGroup* group   /**< input - feature group to store results */
00137 )
00138 {
00139      
00140   // log message
00141   fc_printfLogMessage("Tracking and creating features for a new step.");
00142      
00143   return fc_trackStep_custom(stepIndex, numNew, newSegments, group, NULL, NULL,
00144                     NULL);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00149  * \brief      Track and create features.
00150  *
00151  * \description
00152  *
00153  *    Given the ROIs in each step over a number of steps, this function tracks
00154  *    the ROIs and creates features which are stored in the feature group.
00155  *
00156  * \modifications  
00157  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00158  */
00159 FC_ReturnCode fc_trackAllSteps(
00160   int numStep,            /**< input - the number of steps */ 
00161   int* numSegments,       /**< input - array of number of segments per step */
00162   FC_Subset** segments,   /**< input - array of arrays of segments per step */
00163   FC_FeatureGroup* group  /**< input - feature group to store results */
00164 ) {
00165 
00166   // log message
00167   fc_printfLogMessage("Tracking and creating features."); 
00168 
00169   return fc_trackAllSteps_custom(numStep, numSegments, segments, group, 
00170                      NULL, NULL, NULL);
00171 }
00172 
00173 /**
00174  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00175  * \brief     Track and create features for a new step using custom tracking.
00176  *
00177  * \description
00178  * 
00179  *    This routine is a customizable version of fc_track_add_step().
00180  *    The use can specify a function for each of the three steps 
00181  *    of tracking 
00182  *      -# compute score matrix; 
00183  *      -# compute correspondence matrix; and 
00184  *      -# Assign ROIs to features. 
00185  *
00186  *    A NULL value indicates that the
00187  *    default implementation should be used for that step.
00188  *
00189  * \modifications  
00190  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00191  */
00192 FC_ReturnCode fc_trackStep_custom(
00193   int stepIndex,           /**< input - the index of the step */
00194   int numNew,              /**< input - the number of new segments */
00195   FC_Subset* newSegments,  /**< input - the new segments to be added */
00196   FC_FeatureGroup* group,  /**< input - feature group to store results */
00197   int compute_scores(int, FC_Subset*, int, FC_Subset*, double***), 
00198         /**< input - user provided routine for computing the overlap table. 
00199         If NULL is passed, will use the default routine */
00200   int compute_correspondence(int, int, double**, int***), 
00201         /**< input - user provided routine for computing the correspondence 
00202         matrix. If NULL is passed, will use the default routine */
00203   int add_rois_to_features(int, int, int, FC_Subset*, int**, FC_FeatureGroup*)
00204         /**< input - user proved routine for assigning features based on 
00205         correspondence matrix. If NULL is passed, will use the default 
00206         routine */
00207 )
00208 {
00209   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00210   int numPrev;
00211   double **overlaps;
00212   int **matrix;
00213   FC_Subset *prevSegments;
00214 
00215   // check input
00216   if (stepIndex < 0 || numNew < 0 || (numNew > 0 && !newSegments) || !group) {
00217     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00218     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00219   }
00220 
00221   // log message
00222   fc_printfLogMessage("Tracking and creating features for a new step "
00223                 "using custom tracking routines.");
00224 
00225   // assign any default routines
00226   if (compute_scores == NULL)
00227     compute_scores = &fc_computeNumOverlapScore;
00228   if (compute_correspondence == NULL)
00229     compute_correspondence = &fc_computeSimpleCorrespond;
00230   if (add_rois_to_features == NULL)
00231     add_rois_to_features = &fc_addROIsUsingBasicEvents;
00232 
00233   // Get the previous step's ROIs
00234   if (stepIndex == 0) {
00235     numPrev = 0;
00236     prevSegments = NULL;
00237   }
00238   else {
00239     rc = fc_featureGroup_getROIsInStep(group, stepIndex-1, &numPrev,
00240                            &prevSegments);
00241     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00242       return rc;
00243   }
00244 
00245   // first compute overlaps
00246   rc = compute_scores(numPrev, prevSegments, numNew, newSegments, &overlaps);
00247   free(prevSegments);
00248   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00249     _fc_freeDoubleMatrix(numPrev, numNew, overlaps);
00250     return rc;
00251   }
00252 
00253   // second, compute correspondence matrix
00254   rc = compute_correspondence(numPrev, numNew, overlaps, &matrix);
00255   _fc_freeDoubleMatrix(numPrev, numNew, overlaps);
00256   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00257     _fc_freeIntMatrix(numPrev, numNew, matrix);
00258     return rc;
00259   }
00260 
00261   // third & last, use correspondence matrix to decide on new features
00262   rc = add_rois_to_features(stepIndex, numPrev, numNew, newSegments, matrix,
00263                    group);
00264   _fc_freeIntMatrix(numPrev, numNew, matrix);
00265 
00266   return rc;
00267 }
00268 
00269 /**
00270  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00271  * \brief  Track and create features using custom tracking.
00272  *
00273  * \description
00274  *  
00275  *    This routine is a customizable version of fc_track().
00276  *    The use can specify a function for each of the three steps 
00277  *    of tracking 
00278  *         -# compute score matrix; 
00279  *         -# compute correspondence matrix; and 
00280  *         -# Assign ROIs to features. 
00281  *
00282  *    A NULL value indicates that the
00283  *    default implementation should be used for that step.
00284  *
00285  * \modifications  
00286  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00287  */
00288 FC_ReturnCode fc_trackAllSteps_custom(
00289   int numStep,            /**< input - the number of steps */ 
00290   int* numSegments,       /**< input - array of number of segments per step */
00291   FC_Subset** segments,   /**< input - numStep arrays of segments */
00292   FC_FeatureGroup* group, /**< input - feature group to store results */
00293   int compute_scores(int, FC_Subset*, int, FC_Subset*, double***), 
00294         /**< input - user provided routine for computing the overlap table. 
00295         If NULL is passed,  will use the default routine */
00296   int compute_correspondence(int, int, double**, int***), 
00297         /**< input - user provided routine for computing the correspondence 
00298         matrix. If NULL is passed, will use the default routine */
00299   int add_rois_to_features(int, int, int, FC_Subset*, int**, FC_FeatureGroup*)
00300         /**< input - user proved routine for assigning features based on 
00301         correspondence matrix. If NULL is passed, will use the default 
00302         routine */
00303 ) {
00304 
00305   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00306   int i;
00307 
00308   // check input FIX add
00309   if (numStep < 1 || numSegments == NULL || segments == NULL || group == NULL) {
00310     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00311     return FC_ERROR;
00312   }
00313 
00314   // log message
00315   fc_printfLogMessage("Tracking and creating features using custom tracking.");
00316 
00317   // add the steps
00318   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
00319     rc = fc_trackStep_custom(i, numSegments[i], segments[i], group, 
00320                     compute_scores, compute_correspondence, 
00321                     add_rois_to_features);
00322     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00323       return FC_ERROR;
00324   }
00325 
00326   return FC_SUCCESS;
00327 }
00328 
00329 /**
00330  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00331  * \brief Compute Score Matrix based on overlapping entities.
00332  *
00333  * \description
00334  *
00335  *    Given a list of previous ROIs and a list of new ROIs, this routine
00336  *    computes the score matrix used to decide which ROIs belong in the same
00337  *    features. This default routine computes the scores as the number of mesh
00338  *    entities (e.g. vertices, elements) that the ROIs have in common. It
00339  *    requires that mesh entity IDs do not change between the steps (i.e.
00340  *    static topology).
00341  *
00342  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the dynamically allocated matrix.
00343  *
00344  *    Note that if numPrev or numNew are 0, no matrix will be generated.
00345  *
00346  *    \todo Should we enforce matching of entity types?
00347  *
00348  * \modifications  
00349  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00350  */
00351 FC_ReturnCode fc_computeNumOverlapScore(
00352   int numPrev,           /**< input - number of segments in previous step*/
00353   FC_Subset* prevLists,  /**< input - previous ROIs */
00354   int numNew,            /**< input - number of segments in new step*/
00355   FC_Subset* newLists,   /**< input - new ROIs */
00356   double*** scores_p     /**< output - pointer to a numPrev x numNew matrix */
00357 ) {
00358   // assumes unchanging geometry & sorted arrays
00359   // returns number of entities in common
00360   FC_ReturnCode rc; 
00361   int i, j;
00362   double **scores;
00363   int* arrayA, numA, A;
00364   int* arrayB, numB, B;
00365 
00366   // default return
00367   if (scores_p)
00368     *scores_p = NULL;
00369 
00370   // check input
00371   if (numPrev < 0 || (numPrev > 0 && ! prevLists) || numNew < 0 ||
00372       (numNew > 0 && !newLists) || !scores_p)  {
00373     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00374     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00375   }
00376 
00377   // log message
00378   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing Score Matrix.");
00379 
00380   // early return if no overlaps to compute
00381   if (numPrev == 0 || numNew == 0) 
00382     return FC_SUCCESS;
00383 
00384   // create space for the overlap array
00385   scores = malloc(sizeof(double*)*numPrev);
00386   if (scores == NULL) {
00387     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00388     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00389   }
00390   for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) {
00391     scores[i] = malloc(sizeof(double)*numNew);
00392     if (scores[i] == NULL) {
00393       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00394       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00395     }
00396   }
00397   // for each combination of old and new, compute score
00398   for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) {
00399     for (j = 0; j < numNew; j++) {
00400       // walk through both lists at same time:
00401       // if id's match, increment overlap entry & advance both lists
00402       // else if old's id is less than new's, advance the old list
00403       // else advance the new list
00404       scores[i][j] = 0;
00405       rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(prevLists[i], &numA, &arrayA);
00406       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00407         return rc;
00408       rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(newLists[j], &numB, &arrayB);
00409       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00410         return rc;
00411       A = 0; B = 0;
00412       while (A < numA && B < numB) { // when hit end of either list
00413         if (arrayA[A] < arrayB[B])
00414           A++;
00415         else if (arrayA[A] > arrayB[B])
00416           B++; 
00417      else { // equal
00418           scores[i][j]++;
00419           A++;
00420           B++;
00421         }
00422      }
00423       free(arrayA);
00424       free(arrayB);
00425     }
00426   }
00427 
00428   *scores_p = scores;
00429   return FC_SUCCESS;
00430 }
00431 
00432 /**
00433  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00434  * \brief      Compute correspondence matrix
00435  *
00436  * \description 
00437  *
00438  *    Given the score matrix, create the correspondence matrix which has the
00439  *    information for assigning ROIs to Features. This default implementation
00440  *    just rounds the score matrix values to ints using the C rint() function
00441  *    to do the rounding. Rint usually behaves so that values of exactly *.5
00442  *    are rounded up when * is odd and rounded down when * is even. (Examples:
00443  *    0.5 => 0, 1.5 => 2, -0.5 => 0, -1.5 => -2.)
00444  *
00445  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the dynamically allocated matrix. 
00446  *
00447  *    Note that if numPrev or numNew are 0, no matrix will be generated.
00448  *
00449  * \modifications  
00450  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00451  */
00452 FC_ReturnCode fc_computeSimpleCorrespond(
00453   int numPrev,     /**< input - number of segments in previous step*/
00454   int numNew,      /**< input - number of segments in new step*/
00455   double** scores, /**< input - the score matrix, numPrev x numNew */
00456   int*** matrix_p  /**< output - pointer to correspd. matrix, numPrev x numNew */
00457 ) {
00458   int i, j;
00459 
00460   // default return
00461   if (matrix_p)
00462     *matrix_p = NULL;
00463 
00464   // check input
00465   if (numPrev < 0 || numNew < 0 || (numPrev > 0 && numNew > 0 && !scores) ||
00466       !matrix_p)  {
00467       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00468       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00469   }
00470   if (scores) {
00471     for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) {
00472       if (!scores[i]) {
00473      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR)); 
00474      return FC_ERROR;
00475       }
00476     }
00477   }
00478 
00479   // log message
00480   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing correspondence matrix.");
00481 
00482   // early return if no overlaps to compute
00483   if (numPrev == 0 || numNew == 0) { 
00484     *matrix_p = NULL;
00485     return FC_SUCCESS;
00486   }
00487 
00488   // create space for the overlap array
00489   (*matrix_p) = malloc(sizeof(int*)*numPrev);
00490   if (*matrix_p == NULL) {
00491     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00492     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00493   }
00494   for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) {
00495     (*matrix_p)[i] = malloc(sizeof(int)*numNew);
00496     if ( (*matrix_p)[i] == NULL) {
00497       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00498       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00499     }
00500   }
00501   // for each entry, convert to an int
00502   for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) 
00503     for (j = 0; j < numNew; j++) 
00504       (*matrix_p)[i][j] = (int)rint(scores[i][j]);
00505 
00506   return FC_SUCCESS;
00507 }
00508 
00509 /**
00510  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00511  * \brief  Add ROIs to the features in a Feature Group
00512  *
00513  * \description
00514  *  
00515  *    Given the new ROIs and the correspondence matrix,
00516  *    create or extend the features in the feature Group.
00517  *    Use the devinition of basic events to decide on features (i.e.
00518  *    all events but continue events create new features).
00519  *
00520  * \modifications  
00521  *    - APR-14-2003  W Koegler  Documented
00522  */
00523 FC_ReturnCode fc_addROIsUsingBasicEvents(
00524   int stepIndex,          /**< input - index of the new step */
00525   int numPrev,            /**< input - number of segments in prev step */
00526   int numNew,             /**< input - number of segments in new step */
00527   FC_Subset* newSegments, /**< input - an array of ROIs */
00528   int** overlaps,         /**< input - pointer to a numPrev X numNew */
00529   FC_FeatureGroup* group  /**< input - feature group to store results */
00530 ) {
00531   FC_ReturnCode rc;  
00532   int i, j;
00533   int idx, id;
00534   int temp_numExist;     // store numExist before adding this step
00535   int* temp_existsIDs;   // store the existsIDs before adding this step
00536   int *numOldOverlaps, *numNewOverlaps;
00537   FC_Subset roi;
00538 
00539   // check input
00540   if (stepIndex < 0 || numPrev < 0 || numNew < 0 || 
00541       (numNew > 0 && !newSegments) || 
00542       (numPrev > 0 && numNew > 0 && !overlaps) || !group)  {
00543       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00544       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00545   }
00546   if (overlaps) {
00547     for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++) {
00548       if (!overlaps[i]) {
00549      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR)); 
00550      return FC_ERROR;
00551       }
00552     }
00553   }
00554 
00555   // log message
00556   fc_printfLogMessage("Adding ROIs to the Feature Group for step %d.",
00557                 stepIndex);
00558 
00559   // if no new segments, no new features 
00560   if (numNew < 1) {
00561     rc = fc_featureGroup_noFeaturesThisStep(group, stepIndex);
00562     return rc;
00563   }
00564 
00565   // get previous step's existing features (should == numPrev)
00566   temp_numExist = 0;
00567   if (stepIndex > 0) {
00568     rc = fc_featureGroup_getFeatureIDsInStep(group, stepIndex-1, 
00569                               &temp_numExist, &temp_existsIDs);
00570     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00571       return rc;
00572     if (temp_numExist != numPrev) {
00573       fc_printfErrorMessage("passed in numPrev does not agree with "
00574                    "feature group");
00575       free(temp_existsIDs);
00576       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00577     }
00578   }
00579 
00580   // if no existing features, all new segments are new features
00581   if (temp_numExist < 1) {
00582     for (i = 0; i < numNew; i++) {
00583       rc = fc_featureGroup_newFeature(group, stepIndex, newSegments[i], &id);
00584       if(rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00585         return rc;
00586     }
00587     return FC_SUCCESS;
00588   }
00589 
00590   // make numOverlap helper arrays
00591   numOldOverlaps = malloc(sizeof(int)*(temp_numExist));
00592   numNewOverlaps = malloc(sizeof(int)*numNew);
00593   if (numOldOverlaps == NULL || numNewOverlaps == NULL) {
00594     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00595     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00596   }
00597   for (i = 0; i < temp_numExist; i++)
00598     numOldOverlaps[i] = 0;
00599   for (i = 0; i < numNew; i++)
00600     numNewOverlaps[i] = 0;
00601   for (i = 0; i < temp_numExist; i++)
00602     for (j = 0; j < numNew; j++)
00603       if (overlaps[i][j] > 0) {
00604         numOldOverlaps[i]++;
00605         numNewOverlaps[j]++;
00606       }
00607 
00608   //temp_numExist = 0;
00609   // look for new features, merges, splits
00610   // test number of overlaps to see what to do
00611   for (i = 0; i < numNew; i++) {
00612     roi = newSegments[i];
00613     
00614     // if no overlaps with previous segments, it's a new feature
00615     if (numNewOverlaps[i] == 0) { 
00616       rc = fc_featureGroup_newFeature(group, stepIndex, roi, &id);
00617       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00618         return rc;
00619     }
00620     
00621     // if there is one overlap it could be a split or just continue
00622     else if (numNewOverlaps[i] == 1) { 
00623       // find old segments index that causes this overlap
00624       for (j = 0; j < temp_numExist; j++)
00625         if (overlaps[j][i] > 0) { 
00626           idx = j;
00627           break;
00628         }
00629       if (numOldOverlaps[idx] == 1) {// this feature just continues
00630         rc = fc_featureGroup_continueFeature(group, temp_existsIDs[idx],
00631                               stepIndex, roi);
00632         if(rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00633           return rc;                          
00634       }
00635       else { // parent has split and this segment is a child
00636         rc = fc_featureGroup_newFeature(group, stepIndex, roi, &id);
00637         if(rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00638           return rc;
00639         rc = fc_featureGroup_setParentChildPair(group, temp_existsIDs[idx],
00640                               id);
00641         if(rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00642           return rc;
00643       }
00644     }
00645     
00646     // if there are more than one overlaps, it's a merge product
00647     else { 
00648       // make a new feature and then add as child to previous features
00649       rc = fc_featureGroup_newFeature(group, stepIndex, roi, &id);
00650       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00651         return rc;
00652       for (j = 0; j < temp_numExist; j++) 
00653         if (overlaps[j][i] > 0) {
00654           idx = (temp_existsIDs)[j];
00655           rc = fc_featureGroup_setParentChildPair(group, idx, id);
00656           if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00657             return rc;
00658         }
00659     }
00660   }
00661 
00662   // cleanup
00663   free(temp_existsIDs);
00664   free(numOldOverlaps);
00665   free(numNewOverlaps);
00666 
00667   return FC_SUCCESS;
00668 }
00669 
00670 /**
00671  * \ingroup  FeatureTracking
00672  * \brief  Group objects based on self-correspondance scores.
00673  *
00674  * \description 
00675  *
00676  *    Given a self-correspondance matrix (= for N objects, an N X N matrix
00677  *    where non-zero entry E(i,j) indicates that objects i and j 
00678  *    "correspond"), returns groups of entities that correspond.
00679  * 
00680  *    For example, if a matrix has only non-zero entries on the diagonal,
00681  *    N groups will be returned with 1 object per group. If all entries
00682  *    are non-zero, 1 group will be returned with all N objects.  
00683  *
00684  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the dynamically allocated
00685  *    returns: free(numPerGroup) and for (i=0; i<numGroup; i++) {
00686  *    free(idsPerGroup[i]); } free(idsPerGroup).
00687  *
00688  * \modifications  
00689  *    - 03/14/06 WSD Created
00690  */
00691 FC_ReturnCode fc_groupSelfCorrespond(
00692   int num,           /**< input - number of objects */
00693   int** corresponds, /**< input - the corresponds, num X num, only
00694                 upper tri required (because it's symmetric) */
00695   int* numGroup,     /**< output - the number of groups */
00696   int** numPerGroup, /**< output - the number of objects per group,
00697                caller is responsible for freeing */
00698   int*** idsPerGroup /**< output - array of ids of objects per group,
00699                caller is responsible for freeing */
00700 ) {
00701   int i, j, k;
00702   int ret;
00703   int* parents, parentID, temp_num;
00704   FC_SortedIntArray* lists;
00705 
00706   // default return
00707   if (numGroup)
00708     *numGroup = -1;
00709   if (numPerGroup)
00710     *numPerGroup = NULL;
00711   if (idsPerGroup)
00712     *idsPerGroup = NULL;
00713 
00714   // check input
00715   if (num < 1 || !corresponds || !numGroup || !numPerGroup || !idsPerGroup)  {
00716       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00717       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00718   }
00719   for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00720     if (!corresponds[i]) {
00721       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR)); 
00722       return FC_ERROR;
00723     }
00724   }
00725 
00726   // log message
00727   fc_printfLogMessage("Grouping using self corresponds.");
00728 
00729   // initialize data structures
00730   parents = (int*)malloc(num*sizeof(int));
00731   lists = (FC_SortedIntArray*)malloc(num*sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
00732   if (!parents || !lists) {
00733     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR)); 
00734     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00735   }
00736   for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00737     parents[i] = -1; // means "none"
00738     fc_initSortedIntArray(&lists[i]);
00739   }
00740 
00741   // do it - keep track of ultimate "parent" for each obj
00742   //         accumulate groups in list on ultimate parents
00743   for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00744     // process diagonal entry (assumed to be nonzero)
00745     parentID = parents[i];
00746     if (parentID < 0) {
00747       parentID = i;
00748       ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[parentID], i);
00749       if (ret < FC_SUCCESS)
00750      return ret;
00751     }
00752     // process the rest of entries on this row
00753     for (j = i+1; j < num; j++) {
00754       if (corresponds[i][j] > 0) { // only process non-zero entries
00755      if (parents[j] == -1) {
00756        // add j to current parent's list
00757        parents[j] = parentID;
00758        ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[parentID], j);
00759        if (ret < FC_SUCCESS)
00760          return ret;
00761      }
00762      else if (parents[j] > parentID) {  
00763        // move j's parent's list into current parent's list
00764        int tempParent = parents[j];
00765        for (k = 0; k < lists[tempParent].numVal; k++)
00766          parents[lists[tempParent].vals[k]] = parentID;
00767        fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(&lists[parentID], 
00768                           lists[tempParent].numVal,
00769                           lists[tempParent].vals, 1);
00770        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&lists[tempParent]);
00771      }
00772      else if (parents[j] < parentID) {
00773        // move current parent's list to j's parent's list
00774        int tempParent = parentID;
00775        parentID = parents[j];
00776        for (k = 0; k < lists[tempParent].numVal; k++)
00777          parents[lists[tempParent].vals[k]] = parentID;
00778        fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(&lists[tempParent],
00779                           lists[parentID].numVal,
00780                           lists[parentID].vals, 1);
00781        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&lists[parentID]);
00782      }
00783      // if parents[j] == parentID, j already in list, do nothing
00784       }
00785     }
00786   }
00787   free(parents);
00788 
00789   // count groups
00790   temp_num = 0;
00791   for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00792     if (lists[i].numVal > 0)
00793       temp_num++;
00794   }
00795 
00796   // Convert group lists to arrays
00797   *numGroup = temp_num;
00798   *numPerGroup = (int*)malloc(temp_num*sizeof(int));
00799   *idsPerGroup = (int**)malloc(temp_num*sizeof(int*));
00800   if (!(*numPerGroup) || !(*idsPerGroup)) {
00801     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR)); 
00802     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00803   }
00804   temp_num = 0;
00805   for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00806     if (lists[i].numVal > 0) {
00807       (*numPerGroup)[temp_num] = lists[i].numVal;
00808       (*idsPerGroup)[temp_num] = lists[i].vals;
00809       temp_num++;
00810     }
00811   }
00812   // don't have to free individual lists 'cause they are passed off
00813   free(lists);
00814 
00815   return FC_SUCCESS;
00816 }
00817 
00818 /**
00819  * \ingroup  FeatureTrackingPrivateHelpers
00820  * \brief  Free int matrix
00821  *
00822  * \description
00823  *  
00824  *    This is a convenience utility to free matrices that are set up
00825  *    as 2D arrays.
00826  *
00827  * \modifications  
00828  *    - 11/15/04 WSK, changed name and no longer sets freed pointer
00829  *         to NULL.
00830  */
00831 void _fc_freeIntMatrix(
00832   int numPrev,     /**< input - number of segments in previous step */
00833   int numNew,      /**< input - number of segments in new step*/
00834   int** matrix_p   /**< input - matrix to free */
00835 ) {
00836   int i;
00837 
00838   if (numPrev > 0 && numNew > 0 && matrix_p) {
00839     for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++)
00840       if (matrix_p[i])
00841         free(matrix_p[i]);
00842     free(matrix_p);
00843   }
00844 
00845   return;
00846 }
00847 
00848 /**
00849  * \ingroup  FeatureTrackingPrivateHelpers
00850  * \brief  Free double matrix
00851  *
00852  * \description
00853  *  
00854  *    This is a convenience utility to free matrices that are set up
00855  *    as 2D arrays.
00856  *
00857  * \modifications  
00858  *    - 11/15/04 WSK, changed name and no longer sets freed pointer
00859  *         to NULL.
00860  */
00861 void _fc_freeDoubleMatrix(
00862   int numPrev,        /**< input - number of segments in previous step*/
00863   int numNew,         /**< input - number of segments in new step*/
00864   double** matrix_p   /**< input - matrix to free */
00865 ) {
00866   int i;
00867 
00868   if (numPrev > 0 && numNew > 0 && matrix_p) {
00869     for (i = 0; i < numPrev; i++)
00870       if (matrix_p[i])
00871         free(matrix_p[i]);
00872     free(matrix_p);
00873   }
00874 
00875   return;
00876 }
